translation.en: [Tony Joiner] The whole game! The whole game, go full speed! Seek the win!
I'm telling you, on the sideline, bitch, you better be up for every play!
You better be into this motherfucker here, boy!
[Brandon Siler] Rest of the season here! This determines the rest of our season.
Get out there! Leave it out there, boy!
When you come to Florida, football is the world here, you know?
Losing was unacceptable, and when you did lose, you paid for it.
translation.ko: 패배는 용납 못 하죠 지면 대가를 치러야 해요

translation.en: [Urban Meyer] All right, listen up, let's go.
translation.ko: 잘 들어, 최고의 팀이 이기는 거야

translation.en: May the best team win. You got the edge. You got toughness, you got togetherness.
translation.ko: 잘 들어, 최고의 팀이 이기는 거야 우리가 유리하고 강하고 팀워크도 좋아

translation.en: There's nothing like the locker room, there's nothing like a huddle.
translation.ko: 라커 룸 작전회의만큼 좋은 게 없죠

translation.en: I want them to embrace the heart, embrace the hurt, embrace the pain, embrace the brotherhood.
translation.ko: 선수들이 마음과 아픔, 고통 형제애를 받아들였으면 해요

translation.en: No matter how talented you are, it still comes down to that brotherhood
translation.ko: 아무리 재능 있어도 결국은 서로 위하며 뛰는 형제애가 제일 중요해요

translation.en: of playing for one another.
translation.ko: 결국은 서로 위하며 뛰는 형제애가 제일 중요해요

translation.en: It's all about now. It's all about now.
You work your whole life for a couple moments. You got that moment right now.
translation.ko: 바로 이 순간을 위해서 너희가 평생 노력한 거야

translation.en: [Brandon Spikes] You know, football was my way out. Out of the hood.
translation.ko: 풋볼은 거친 동네에서 벗어나게 해줄 수단이었죠

translation.en: So I was willing to do whatever it took.
Bring it on, baby! Bring it on!
Motivation, baby!
[Paul Finebaum] In a moment in time, between 2005 and 2010…
National Championship, baby! Number one.
[Finebaum] …it looked like Urban Meyer and Florida
were going to win the National Championship every year.
-[cheering] -Let's go! Let's go!
We were The Beatles, you know? We really were.
[Chris Rainey] It was crazy.
Girls are falling out, fainting. All-- Man, you'd be like, "What the…?"
translation.ko: 여자들이 막 쓰러지고 이게 웬일인가 싶었죠

translation.en: I'm sorry. Um, extremely sorry.
And then somehow, it all slipped away.
translation.ko: 그런데 어쩌다 보니 다 무너져 버렸어요

translation.en: Put them motherfuckers away, man! Come on, man.
translation.ko: 그 망할 것 좀 치워, 정신 차려!

translation.en: The pain of greatness is real.
-[grunts] -[Meyer] And it's not meant for everybody.
[reporter] Two University of Florida athletes have been suspended.
translation.ko: 플로리다 대학교 선수 2명이 출장 정지를 당했습니다

translation.en: All right, another Florida Gator has been arrested.
We got 30 minutes… Let's go! …for the rest of our lives!
translation.ko: 지금 주어진 30분이 우리 인생을 결정하는 거야!

translation.en: I was ready to fight. "It's time to fight."
translation.ko: 저는 준비돼 있었어요 싸울 순간이 온 거예요

translation.en: People don't realize the level of stress and anxiety and pressure
translation.ko: 사람들은 그 엄청난 스트레스와 불안과 압박감을 알지 못해요

translation.en: because they really do not know
translation.ko: 뭔가에 그 정도로 쏟아붓는 게 어떤지

translation.en: what it's like to give so much to something.
translation.ko: 뭔가에 그 정도로 쏟아붓는 게 어떤지 잘 모르니까요

translation.en: That's everything.
This is going to be un-fucking-believable.
[man] Thank y'all for coming this afternoon.
Obviously, this is a, um, special day for the University of Florida.
[Meyer] The day that I walked into The Swamp, it was like a dream.
translation.ko: 스왐프 경기장에 들어선 날은 꿈만 같았어요

translation.en: [man] Ladies and gentlemen, Coach Urban Meyer.
I walked down to the 50-yard-line, I see the bright blue skies.
translation.ko: 50야드 라인에 들어서는데 26도의 화창한 날씨에 모든 게 아름다웠어요

translation.en: It's 80 degrees, everything is beautiful.
And I thought, "Let's go win a national title."
Thank you very much. I would like to thank Dr. Machen
translation.ko: 저를 감독으로 불러주신 매천 박사님과 제러미 폴리에게

translation.en: and Jeremy Foley for the opportunity to coach the Gators.
translation.ko: 저를 감독으로 불러주신 매천 박사님과 제러미 폴리에게 감사 말씀 드립니다

translation.en: [Finebaum] Florida had this incredible run in the '90s under Steve Spurrier,
translation.ko: 플로리다 대학교는 90년대에 스티브 스퍼리어의 지휘 아래 엄청난 전성기를 누렸습니다

translation.en: playing for national championships every year.
[announcer] The 1996 National Champions!
That was almost a period of just drunken joy for Gator fans.
translation.ko: 그때 게이터스 팬들은 행복에 취해 있었어요 "폴 파인바움 스포츠 기자 & 중계자"

translation.en: But by 2005, Florida was not winning.
We were letting down the people that were counting on us by losing,
translation.ko: 우린 팬들을 실망시키고 있었어요 "브랜던 사일러 '04~'06년 라인배커"

translation.en: by not being who we supposed to be, not doing the things we supposed to do.
translation.ko: 패배하고 실력 발휘도 못 하고 해야 할 일을 제대로 못 했죠

translation.en: The team, just in general, wasn't really respected with--
translation.ko: 우리 팀은 게인즈빌에서 별로 존중을 못 받았어요

translation.en: throughout the community of Gainesville.
We-- We wasn't winning games, so no free drinks at the bars. [laughs]
translation.ko: 이기지를 못하니까 바에서 공짜 술도 안 줬죠

translation.en: [Pat Dooley] They were a sleeping giant.
translation.ko: "게인즈빌 선" 게이터스는 잠자는 사자였어요 물론 어번은 유명 감독이었고요

translation.en: And then, of course, Urban was the hot name.
translation.ko: 게이터스는 잠자는 사자였어요 물론 어번은 유명 감독이었고요 "팻 둘리 '게인즈빌 선' 칼럼니스트"

translation.en: [Finebaum] I mean, the feeling was that, with going out and getting Urban Meyer,
translation.ko: 어번 마이어를 데려오면 "유타 떠나는 감독 까다로운 스타일"

translation.en: Florida could restore what they had lost.
translation.ko: 플로리다 팀의 실력이 되살아날 것 같았어요

translation.en: But while it was an exciting hire,
translation.ko: 그런데 감독 선임에 기대가 크긴 했지만

translation.en: you-- you were getting someone that was virtually unknown.
Meyer had only been a head coach four years at two different places.
translation.ko: 마이어의 경력은 4년간 두 팀을 감독한 게 다였죠

translation.en: Florida fans wanted a winner,
translation.ko: 플로리다 팬들은 성공한 감독을 원했어요 "어번으로 교체 게이터스의 새 감독"

translation.en: and they're not patient people.
Florida play in the Southeastern Conference.
We call it the SEC.
And college football in the South is like a life-and-death experience.
translation.ko: 그런데 남부 대학들은 풋볼을 죽기 살기로 해요

translation.en: [Finebaum] Watching Florida play Tennessee or Florida play Georgia
translation.ko: 플로리다가 테네시나 조지아와 경기하는 걸 보면

translation.en: is no different than watching gladiators fight to the death.
translation.ko: 플로리다가 테네시나 조지아와 경기하는 걸 보면 검투사가 목숨 걸고 싸우는 거랑 비슷해요

translation.en: It's the same emotion. "Kill or be killed."
translation.ko: 똑같은 심정인 겁니다 '안 죽이면 내가 죽는다'

translation.en: [Dooley] Urban Meyer did not know the SEC, he did not know the South,
translation.ko: 어번 마이어는 SEC나 남부에 대해 몰랐어요

translation.en: and sometimes that can be a problem.
You win games, everybody loves you.
If you lose one, or one big game,
translation.ko: "테이트 케이시 '04~'08년 타이트 엔드" 중요한 경기 하나만 져도 비난의 화살이 쏟아지면서

translation.en: that's when the criticism really starts flying.
translation.ko: 중요한 경기 하나만 져도 비난의 화살이 쏟아지면서

translation.en: And it can get out of hand quick.
[Meyer] I came from a hardcore background.
My father was in the Army. My sister was in the Air Force.
So I've always been that kind of approach, a militaristic approach to your team.
translation.ko: 그래서 팀을 대할 때도 군대식으로 하게 돼요

translation.en: And there was a narrative about the Gators, about lack of discipline.
translation.ko: 게다가 게이터스의 기강이 해이하다는 얘기가 있어서

translation.en: And I got after 'em pretty good.
'Cause I knew, you get discipline into those players, you should win most games.
Coach really… I mean, he ripped into us.
[Harris] He called us to the stadium at five o'clock in the morning,
and he made us run every step in the stadium.
He called everybody out.
Said whether you got in trouble with the police, or with the school or whatever,
that we would not have any of these problems.
I mean, I'm from Miami, you know?
A fistfight is-- was nothing for us.
Coach Meyer got there and kicked all of us out of the home locker room.
translation.ko: 마이어 감독님은 우리를 홈 라커 룸에서 쫓아내고

translation.en: Made us get dressed in the visitors' locker room.
Told us we couldn't wear any Gator stuff.
Like, "You have to earn the right to be a Florida Gator."
translation.ko: 그걸 입을 자격은 스스로 얻으라고 하셨죠

translation.en: [Meyer] To say it was warm welcoming?
Not at all.
If I was to win big,
translation.ko: 큰 승리를 거두려면 팀 전력을 쌓아야 했어요

translation.en: I needed to build this team, and I need to know who's in and who's out.
translation.ko: 큰 승리를 거두려면 팀 전력을 쌓아야 했어요 누굴 빼고 넣을지 파악해야 했습니다

translation.en: Mat drills completely changed the game.
[Harris] One person would get down, the other person would jump on his back,
translation.ko: 한 사람이 누우면 다른 사람이 달려들어서

translation.en: and you gotta stop him from crawling.
Just the most grueling physical pain
translation.ko: 체력적으로 제일 진 빠지고 고통스러운 훈련입니다

translation.en: you can be in, right? And there's a winner and there's a loser.
translation.ko: 체력적으로 제일 진 빠지고 고통스러운 훈련입니다 승패도 갈라요

translation.en: Everybody's screaming, teammates cheering you on.
translation.ko: 다들 소리 지르고 동료들이 응원하죠 "라이언 스탬퍼 '05~'09년 라인배커"

translation.en: I mean, it was-- it was Vietnam.
It was-- When I say "hard," the hardest thing I ever went through in my life.
You are fucking giving in. Stop faking it, bro.
[Meyer] My attempt was to get people that weren't committed to quit the team,
translation.ko: 최선을 다하지 않는 선수는 제 발로 나가게 하려는 의도였죠

translation.en: and find out who was going to be all-in.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 바칠 선수를 가려내기 위해서요

translation.en: It was unmerciful.
[Meyer] When I take over a team, I need to find the leaders.
translation.ko: 감독을 맡고 나서 리더를 찾아야 했어요

translation.en: And the guy that started to rise to the top was a guy named Brandon Siler.
translation.ko: 그때 치고 올라온 게 브랜던 사일러입니다

translation.en: [Siler] When Urban showed up, my very first impression of him was bad.
translation.ko: 감독님이 오셨을 때 첫인상은 안 좋았어요

translation.en: I'm like, "I don't like this guy. I don't know who this guy is."
I grew up in Pine Hills, which is the projects and all that, though.
translation.ko: 저는 어릴 때 파인 힐스의 저소득층 주택 단지에 살았어요

translation.en: If you want to play Grand Theft Auto for real,
translation.ko: 범죄 어드벤처 게임 '그랜드 테프트 오토' 있죠?

translation.en: go to Pine Hills after dark.
translation.ko: 파인 힐스의 밤 풍경이 그 게임 실사판이에요

translation.en: [laughs] So that's where I'm from.
I knew that I wanted something different.
And then when I got on campus, it was a little bit of a culture shock.
translation.ko: 그러다 대학에 와서 문화 충격을 받았죠

translation.en: Where I come from, there's not a lot of, um, white people, you know?
translation.ko: 제가 살던 곳에는 백인이 별로 없었거든요

translation.en: But real quickly, you start to understand
that there's another world out there that's different from the one that you were brought up in.
translation.ko: 내가 살던 세상과는 다른 세상이 있다는 걸요

translation.en: When Urban came to University of Florida, he wants you to work out to the death.
translation.ko: 어번 감독님은 플로리다에 와서 죽을 만큼 운동을 시키셨어요

translation.en: I want to work out to the death!
I'll take the big boy.
I'll take the fullback!
He wanted to win. I want to win!
I'll take the fullback down.
And this is where I bought in.
It wasn't about lifting weights.
Go, go, go!
-[Siler] It was about mental toughness. -Go!
He wanted to understand what happens after he breaks you.
translation.ko: 감독님은 선수들을 압박하면서 어떻게 반응하는지 보셨어요

translation.en: Straight arms. Straight arms!
Are you gonna just push through it, or you gonna cry like a baby? You gonna quit?
[Meyer] Most people grab their bag and go home.
translation.ko: 대부분은 그러면 짐 싸서 집에 갑니다

translation.en: -I'm going clutch. -[man] Let's go! Push that shit up!
You know what Brandon Silers do? That's when they get better.
translation.ko: 브랜던 사일러 같은 선수들은 그렇게 하면 더 발전하고요

translation.en: I mean, he was vocal, a great player, tough as nails, and all-in.
translation.ko: 자기주장도 잘하고 실력 좋고 아주 강인하고 혼신을 다했죠

translation.en: He was the perfect leader.
But he was far from easy to manage.
[Siler] Everything I did, I did it to the death.
And I drank a lot, right? I like to drink.
So one day, Urban calls me in the office. He says, "You know what?"
translation.ko: 어느 날 감독님이 저를 부르셨어요 저한테 그러시더군요

translation.en: "I'm calling your parents up. I'mma have a talk with 'em."
My mom's a character.
My step-dad, he had 13 gold teeth in his mouth.
My mom got gold teeth in her mouth. They both got ten tattoos.
translation.ko: 어머니도 금니가 있으시고 두 분 다 문신도 10개나 있죠

translation.en: [chuckling] So, they show up to campus, they've been drinking all day.
translation.ko: 그런데 학교에 오시는 날 술을 잔뜩 마신 거예요

translation.en: And my mama says, "Meyers, listen."
"My son come here to win a National Championship and go to the NFL."
translation.ko: '내 아들은 전국 우승 하고 NFL 가려고 이 학교 왔어요'

translation.en: "So if you ain't here to do that, then you need to get out the way."
"This ain't Utah." [laughs]
[Meyer] I don't understand his world. I don't know the streets, you know?
translation.ko: 저는 브랜던의 세계를 몰라요 브랜던이 자란 환경을 모르죠 그래서 충격이 컸습니다

translation.en: That's why I was so shocked.
translation.ko: 브랜던이 자란 환경을 모르죠 그래서 충격이 컸습니다

translation.en: [Siler] They have this whole conversation, they walk out the door.
He says, "Come here."
Gives me a hug. He says…
"You just keep doing what you're doing."
"That's the craziest set of parents I've ever met."
translation.ko: '저런 정신 나간 부모는 내 생전 처음 봤다'

translation.en: [Meyer] The season started in '05, and…
translation.ko: 2005년 시즌이 시작됐는데 "어번의 전쟁에 온 걸 환영한다"

translation.en: I thought I knew big-time football.
translation.ko: 저도 풋볼에 대한 열기는 잘 안다고 생각했죠

translation.en: You don't know big-time football until you start messing around
translation.ko: 하지만 동남부 대회에 나가보면 그 광기를 제대로 실감할 수 있습니다

translation.en: in that Southeastern Conference.
translation.ko: 그 광기를 제대로 실감할 수 있습니다

translation.en: [announcer] A new ingredient into this bitter stew, the Urban Meyer experience.
translation.ko: 쓰디쓴 스튜에 어번 마이어라는 새로운 재료를 넣은 격입니다

translation.en: [Meyer] I remember hearing a contact…
…two sledgehammers, every snap.
translation.ko: 스냅 때마다 큰 망치끼리 맞부딪치는 것 같았습니다

translation.en: Never been exposed to the athletic big men
that play the game of football in the SEC.
You know, the first game was against Wyoming.
We won, and it wasn't-- It was good, it was great.
We beat Tennessee in game three, in a really tight game.
We beat Kentucky.
[announcer] Gators score on seven straight possessions,
as Urban Meyer's fifth-ranked team wins a fourth straight game.
[Finebaum] There was excitement about Urban Meyer.
He was a smart, intellectual tactitioner of the game.
We had heard so much about, uh, the spread offense that Urban Meyer brought to Florida.
translation.ko: 마이어가 플로리다에 적용한 스프레드 오펜스 얘기가 많았죠

translation.en: My offensive philosophy? Score and score fast.
[Meyer] You know, my reputation as a younger coach was trick plays,
translation.ko: 저는 젊은 시절에 위장 전술이나 페이크 펀트 스프레드 오펜스로 유명했어요

translation.en: and fake punts, and spread offense.
translation.ko: 위장 전술이나 페이크 펀트 스프레드 오펜스로 유명했어요

translation.en: Like a fast break on turf.
[Meyer] And then, when I met Dan Mullen, we shared the same mentality,
translation.ko: 그러다 댄 멀린을 만났는데 저랑 사고방식이 같더군요

translation.en: and that was the basis for the philosophy that we built at Utah.
translation.ko: 그걸 바탕으로 유타에서 코칭 철학을 세웠습니다

translation.en: Urban Meyer had been really good at-- at Utah,
translation.ko: 어번 마이어는 유타에서 성적이 아주 좋았습니다

translation.en: where he was the previous season.
translation.ko: 플로리다 부임 직전 시즌까지 있었던 곳이죠

translation.en: And Dan Mullen was an imaginative offensive play-caller.
translation.ko: 댄 멀린의 플레이 콜은 창의적이고 공격적이었어요

translation.en: It was almost like Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.
translation.ko: 둘이 '내일을 향해 쏴라'의 부치와 선댄스 같았달까요?

translation.en: [announcer] The dream has been realized.
Utah, you did!
[Dooley] You know, they'd had unbelievable success.
And there were things that we were seeing that we had not seen before.
[announcer] Every defensive coach in the country
is looking at a way to slow down this spread offense
translation.ko: 스프레드 오펜스를 저지할 방법을 고민 중입니다

translation.en: that has exploded across college football.
[Dan Mullen] The base idea was to get away from the traditional offense
where the quarterback just stood in the pocket
translation.ko: 기존에는 쿼터백이 안쪽에 서서 공을 던지고

translation.en: and threw the ball,
and you never had to worry about him running.
We wanted to create this offense
translation.ko: 우린 상대의 수비 구역을 넓힐 공격 전술을 짜고 싶었어요

translation.en: where defenses had to defend a quarterback that could throw and run,
translation.ko: 우린 상대의 수비 구역을 넓힐 공격 전술을 짜고 싶었어요 쿼터백이 달려가 공을 던지고

translation.en: running backs that could run and catch,
receivers that could come in and run the ball,
and force you to have to defend the whole width of the field.
translation.ko: 필드의 모든 곳을 수비할 수밖에 없잖아요

translation.en: [announcer] Touchdown, Utah!
The narrative at that time was, "That's great for a Utah,
translation.ko: 당시에 그런 말이 많았습니다 유타에서는 그게 잘 통했지만

translation.en: but that'll never work in the Southeastern Conference."
[announcer] We welcome you to Tuscaloosa.
It is one of the most electrifying places in college football.
translation.ko: "5주 플로리다 - 앨라배마" 대학 풋볼 열기가 가장 뜨거운 곳이죠

translation.en: [Finebaum] You had Urban Meyer from Ohio and Dan Mullen from New Hampshire,
translation.ko: 오하이오의 어번 마이어와 뉴햄프셔의 댄 멀린이

translation.en: and they were coming to Gainesville, Florida
translation.ko: 플로리다 게인즈빌에 대학 풋볼을 어떻게 하는지

translation.en: to teach the rest of us how college football is played.
translation.ko: 플로리다 게인즈빌에 대학 풋볼을 어떻게 하는지 가르쳐주러 온 겁니다

translation.en: So there are always going to be, uh, skeptics
when you're bringing a spread offense to the Southeastern Conference,
translation.ko: 스프레드 오펜스에 계속 회의적일 수밖에 없었어요

translation.en: which was still, primarily, a defensive conference.
[Siler] We roll into Alabama.
We think we're great at this time.
And they were 15th, we were fifth.
translation.ko: 앨라배마는 15위고 우리는 5위니까 이길 거란 기대를 받았죠

translation.en: We were expected to win.
We expected ourselves to win.
[announcer] Fumbles as he is tackled.
And the ball is recovered by Florida.
[Harris] We were on a winning streak at that time,
and that's the first time I got to see Coach Meyer, uh…
his desire for winning.
See the fire in his eyes.
[Meyer] Alabama was one of the first tests. They were a great defensive team.
translation.ko: 첫 시험 대상인 앨라배마는 수비가 뛰어난 팀이었습니다

translation.en: And I had to prove this is not a gimmick offense.
translation.ko: 스프레드가 얄팍한 전술이 아니란 걸 증명해야 했어요

translation.en: "We gotta win that game."
[commentator] Out of the gun, the spread offense.
[announcer] Three-man defensive line right away for Alabama.
They've been going to this more often.
[announcer] Fumble! Fumble.
This is gonna be a physical game.
The offense we ran at the beginning was the offense they tried to run at Utah.
translation.ko: 우리가 초반에 쓴 공격 전술은 유타에서 시도했던 거예요

translation.en: But we just weren't ready to be what he wanted us to be.
translation.ko: 하지만 감독님이 원하는 만큼 준비가 되지는 않은 상태였죠

translation.en: [announcer] That'll be the big challenge for Chris Leak.
When he runs this offense, to really make it go,
you must run your quarterback.
[Siler] Everybody understood what we were trying to do.
But you have to have the right personnel. We had Chris Leak playing quarterback.
translation.ko: 그걸 수행할 수 있는 선수가 필요했어요 우리 쿼터백은 크리스 리크였는데

translation.en: And he was, like, a drop-back, shotgun type of guy.
translation.ko: 뒤로 빠져 스냅을 받고 쏘는 걸 잘하는 선수였어요

translation.en: And then Urban comes with this offense that's used to a running quarterback.
translation.ko: 그런데 어번 감독님 전술은 잘 뛰는 쿼터백한테 잘 맞았죠

translation.en: [announcer] He knocks Chris Leak down, and Penn Wagers says,
translation.ko: 크리스 리크를 쓰러뜨립니다 펜 웨이저스 심판은 반칙이 아니라는군요

translation.en: "Hey, that was a legitimate play."
He's a quarterback. He wants to throw it to somebody.
translation.ko: 리크는 쿼터백이라 공을 던져주려고 하지 뛰고 싶어 하진 않았어요

translation.en: He didn't want to run it.
translation.ko: 공을 던져주려고 하지 뛰고 싶어 하진 않았어요

translation.en: [commentator] …wants to go deep
to Prothro, who's down there!
He's got it!
And he is gone!
No flags.
[Siler] They hit us in the mouth, hard.
I mean, there's losing, and then, there's getting your butt whooped.
translation.ko: 그냥 질 때가 있고 처참하게 질 때가 있는데

translation.en: And we got our butt whooped.
[commentator] This will be Urban Meyer's first loss
translation.ko: 어번 마이어 감독 21 경기 만에 패배를 기록합니다

translation.en: as a coach in his last 21 games.
translation.ko: 어번 마이어 감독 21 경기 만에 패배를 기록합니다 "최종 스코어 플로리다 3 - 앨라배마 31"

translation.en: [announcer] If you're Florida, at this point, now you've gotta go back
to the drawing board a little bit. I mean, everything had gone well for you.
translation.ko: 플로리다 팀은 계획을 수정해야겠죠 지금까지 잘하고 있었는데

translation.en: Now, you're looking at your first loss,
and a somewhat embarrassing loss here in Tuscaloosa.
We get hammered by Alabama, and then we lose to LSU.
[announcer] Nowhere to go with the football. Look at the coverage.
translation.ko: 갈 곳이 없습니다 수비 범위를 보세요

translation.en: [commentator] So much conversation about the spread option.
translation.ko: 스프레드 전술을 두고 많은 얘기가 있습니다

translation.en: Does it, does it not work in the SEC?
[Meyer] We all experienced two devastating losses.
And if we lose one more, we're out of the SEC race.
translation.ko: 한 번만 더 지면 SEC에서 아웃이었죠

translation.en: [Finebaum] Every time you lose a game as a coach in the SEC, it's like suffering a death.
translation.ko: SEC 경기에서 질 때마다 감독에겐 죽음의 고통이에요

translation.en: And it-- it made you wonder that Urban Meyer had better sign some big players.
translation.ko: 사람들은 마이어가 뛰어난 선수를 영입해야 하는 거 아닌가 생각했죠

translation.en: [Mullen] Biggest missing piece in the puzzle
was that quarterback that could not just throw,
but also run with the ball.
[Meyer] One day, as I'm getting off the plane,
a guy that's helping us with our bags, he said, "Hey, you need to recruit this Tim Tebow guy."
translation.ko: 짐을 내려주던 사람이 팀 티보를 영입하라더군요

translation.en: And I go, "Tim Tebow?" And it's the first time I heard his name.
translation.ko: 저는 그게 누군가 했죠 처음 듣는 이름이었어요

translation.en: He goes, "Well, he's the-- He's a quarterback here in Jacksonville
that's a really good player, and, you know, everybody loves him."
translation.ko: 아주 좋은 선수라면서 인기가 많다는 거예요

translation.en: And all that. And I was like, "Okay."
I take another seven steps,
someone else says, "Hey, Tebow!" And he starts screaming at me.
Hey! We will not be stopped! I will not be stopped right now!
And then there's fans behind a-- a gated area.
They're-- Half of 'em are screaming, "Hey, recruit Tebow!"
It was daily. You know, "Tebow, Tebow, Tebow."
After a while, you're, "Okay, enough with the Tebow stuff."
translation.ko: 그러다 얘기만 들을 게 아니다 싶어서

translation.en: So I went and watched him play.
I just remember, I was, like, paralyzed, for just staring at what I was watching.
translation.ko: 그 친구를 보는데 몸이 굳는 것 같았어요

translation.en: Hustling on and off the field, lifting everybody else up around him.
translation.ko: 필드를 여기저기 활보하면서 선수들의 사기를 북돋더군요

translation.en: The unselfishness of the way he was playing the game and the effort, I mean,
I got in my car and said, "That's-- that's gotta be my quarterback."
translation.ko: 저는 차에 타서 말했죠 '우리 쿼터백으로 데려와야 해'

translation.en: Hey, out there, everything for one another, y'all.
Let's go.
My parents told us when we were young,
translation.ko: 어릴 때 부모님이 대학 보내주긴 어려운 형편이라고 하셨어요

translation.en: they're just not gonna be able to afford college.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 부모님이 대학 보내주긴 어려운 형편이라고 하셨어요 "팀 티보 '06~'09년 쿼터백"

translation.en: So if you wanna go, you gotta earn a scholarship.
translation.ko: 그러니 대학 가려면 장학생이 돼야 한다고요

translation.en: I was rated pretty high.
In the top handful of quarterbacks in the country.
I was fortunate to have a lot of schools interested in me.
translation.ko: 다행히 저한테 관심 있는 학교가 많았죠

translation.en: Alabama, and LSU, and Southern Cal, and Michigan, and Ohio State.
translation.ko: 앨라배마, LSU, 서던 캘리포니아 미시간, 오하이오 주립대까지요

translation.en: Florida wasn't even in the picture.
[Meyer] I knew that we had to have Tim Tebow.
At that time, offensively, we were really struggling.
translation.ko: 그때 우리 팀은 공격력 문제가 심각했죠

translation.en: That was ripping my heart apart. That I'm not holding up our end of the bargain.
translation.ko: 잘하겠다는 약속을 못 지켜서 정말 마음이 아팠습니다

translation.en: And, uh, sure enough, we have to go play at South Carolina.
translation.ko: 그런데 사우스캐롤라이나에 경기를 하러 가야 했습니다

translation.en: Steve Spurrier's the coach, he's got a really good team.
translation.ko: 스티브 스퍼리어 감독이 실력 좋은 팀을 맡고 있었죠

translation.en: [announcer] Folks, it has been 66 years
since South Carolina has knocked off Florida.
translation.ko: 사우스캐롤라이나가 플로리다를 이긴 지 66년 됐습니다 "10주 플로리다 - 사우스캐롤라이나"

translation.en: They have lost 14 straight,
including a 37-0 loss to Florida when Steve Spurrier was quarterback.
translation.ko: 스퍼리어가 쿼터백으로 뛰던 플로리다에게 37대 0으로 패한 적도 있습니다

translation.en: [Finebaum] South Carolina was special because it was Steve Spurrier,
translation.ko: 사우스캐롤라이나전은 특별했죠 스퍼리어가 게이터스 출신이라 그 팀을 속속들이 알았으니까요

translation.en: who was a Gator through and through.
translation.ko: 스퍼리어가 게이터스 출신이라 그 팀을 속속들이 알았으니까요

translation.en: Led them to a national championship, then suddenly, he's on the other sideline,
translation.ko: 내셔널 챔피언십 우승 공신이 갑자기 반대편이 된 거예요

translation.en: and it couldn't have gotten any more personal.
[Meyer] Gator Nation wanted Stephen. Make no mistake about it.
They wanted Steve Spurrier back. And I-- I get it.
[Finebaum] Three losses may work for South Carolina, it may work for Mississippi State.
translation.ko: 사우스캐롤라이나와 미시시피는 세 번 져도 괜찮을 수 있지만

translation.en: It doesn't work for Florida.
Not when you've hired "Pope Urban" to come save your program.
We've gotta win this thing, for my survival.
[announcer] Leak being chased, and dragged down at the 25-yard line.
Into the end zone…
Touchdown, South Carolina!
Touchdown, Gamecocks.
Leak, incomplete, looking for Dallas Baker.
translation.ko: 리크, 패스 실패 댈러스 베이커를 찾습니다

translation.en: That is the ballgame.
The South Carolina Gamecocks have given Steve Spurrier
translation.ko: 사우스캐롤라이나 게임콕스가 스티브 스퍼리어 감독에게 첫 승리를 안겨줍니다

translation.en: his first victory as a head coach against his alma mater,
translation.ko: 스티브 스퍼리어 감독에게 첫 승리를 안겨줍니다 스퍼리어의 모교를 꺾었어요

translation.en: and the Carolina fans are going crazy in Williams-Brice Stadium.
translation.ko: 경기장의 캐롤라이나 팬들이 광란의 도가니에 빠졌습니다

translation.en: Urban Meyer, not happy to say the least.
Coach Meyer is probably one of the most competitive people I ever met.
translation.ko: 마이어 감독님처럼 경쟁심이 강한 사람은 못 봤어요

translation.en: He hates losing more than he loves winning.
translation.ko: 이기는 걸 좋아하시고 지는 건 극도로 싫어하세요

translation.en: Coach Meyer'll make an opening statement then we'll open it up for questions.
We'll bring selected players in here.
[Dooley] In the post-game press conference, I saw the first signs
translation.ko: 경기 후 기자회견 때 어번의 스트레스가 얼굴에 훤히 드러났어요

translation.en: of a stressed Urban.
I'll just-- I'll answer some questions.
[Dooley] I felt bad for him.
I mean, he looked like somebody who has-- whose dog had just died.
translation.ko: 키우던 개가 방금 죽은 사람 같았죠

translation.en: [Mullen] It was hard for everyone. I think especially for Urban.
Because when we lost to Steve Spurrier,
who was what Florida thought they should be,
that left a lot of doubt.
translation.ko: 그 후로 많은 사람이 의구심을 품었어요

translation.en: "Is Urban Meyer the right guy?"
Or did Florida make a mistake and it was never gonna get better?
translation.ko: 플로리다가 잘못 선택했고 개선의 여지는 없는 것인가

translation.en: Three losses in the SEC, obviously in Florida, they--
translation.ko: SEC 경기를 세 차례 졌는데 플로리다에서는 더 잘해야 하죠

translation.en: You need to do better than that.
That's a very talented league, obviously.
That was a talented team we just played now.
Losing's not in his DNA.
Just want to get back with my team, and-- and, uh, get back around my players.
[Mullen] He doesn't handle it very well.
And it's not very comfortable for anybody when he does lose.
translation.ko: 경기에서 지고 나면 같이 있기 불편해요

translation.en: [Meyer] We're flying home, and I heard some laughing on the plane.
translation.ko: 집에 가는 비행기에서 웃는 소리가 들렸어요

translation.en: Not all the guys took that loss to heart.
translation.ko: 그날 졌다고 모든 선수가 크게 상심한 건 아니었어요

translation.en: A couple laughs here from guys talking,
and it was a little bit too soon for all that.
That's where it started, I think, to bother him.
[Dooley] He keeps 'em on the tarmac in Gainesville for over an hour.
[Baker] Coach Meyer tells us, "Shut up. You guys aren't gonna get me fired."
translation.ko: 마이어 감독님이 그러셨어요 '닥쳐, 너희 때문에 잘릴 순 없어'

translation.en: He makes all the coaches get off the plane.
And he basically was telling us,
he's given everything he have, but we're not giving everything we have.
translation.ko: 본인은 혼신을 다했는데 우린 그러지 않았다는 거였죠

translation.en: [Casey] He's got the ability to burn a hole in you real quick.
translation.ko: 사람 혼을 쏙 빼놓는 재주가 있는 분이에요

translation.en: In West Texas, they call it a "Coming to Jesus" meeting.
translation.ko: 서부 텍사스 표현으로는 '예수님 만나고 왔다'고 하죠

translation.en: [Meyer] It was a tough, tough meeting.
And I told 'em it was gonna be a miserable time for everybody.
And if you don't want to be here, we'll help you.
Two players, he kicked off the team on the tarmac.
translation.ko: 마이어는 그날 공항에서 곧장 선수 둘을 방출했어요

translation.en: They had to go out on-- you know, down the stairs,
and off the team. They was done.
translation.ko: 비행기에서 내려서 바로 쫓겨난 거예요 끝난 거죠

translation.en: [Casey] From there out, I think that his goal was,
"I'm gonna pound this in their heads so hard,
that it-- it's gonna mean everything to them."
"And if you're not on board with it…" [clicks tongue]
"…there's emergency exits right there."
[Meyer] After the South Carolina loss, after the tarmac meeting…
I walk into this restaurant in Gainesville, Florida.
They boo me.
They boo me.
People starting to question me as a leader.
translation.ko: 사람들은 제 감독 자질을 의심하기 시작했습니다

translation.en: And to say that I lost my confidence, I certainly lost my confidence.
I've never had that much doubt.
I thought, "There's a decent chance this one's over."
translation.ko: 정말 끝일 수도 있겠다는 생각까지 했으니까요

translation.en: [Finebaum] How does he save this disaster?
translation.ko: 그 처참한 난국을 어떻게 타개해야 할까요?

translation.en: And it really came down to one thing,
landing a major fish on the recruiting trail.
It keeps the fans excited during the winter, and sets up for the next year.
translation.ko: 다음 해를 준비하는 겨울 동안 팬들은 선수 영입에 기대가 컸어요

translation.en: Tim Tebow, you may not know the name, but come Tuesday,
translation.ko: 팀 티보는 유명 선수는 아니지만 돌아오는 화요일 대학 풋볼의 화제가 될 전망입니다

translation.en: he will be the talk of college football.
translation.ko: 돌아오는 화요일 대학 풋볼의 화제가 될 전망입니다

translation.en: That's because the Nease quarterback is the most sought-after player in the country.
translation.ko: 니스 고교의 쿼터백 티보가 전국에서 영입 희망 1순위죠

translation.en: [Siler] Tebow was different, for a lot of reasons.
translation.ko: 티보는 여러 가지로 다른 점이 많았어요

translation.en: You know, here's a guy that went to homeschool.
Religious background, mom and dad, they were missionaries.
translation.ko: 종교적인 배경도 그렇고 부모님이 선교사라는데 여러 가지로 정말 생소했죠

translation.en: I didn't understand any of that.
translation.ko: 부모님이 선교사라는데 여러 가지로 정말 생소했죠

translation.en: [reporter] On Tuesday, Tebow will announce on national television
translation.ko: 화요일에 티보가 어떤 대학에 갈지 전국 방송에서 발표합니다

translation.en: where he plans to attend college.
translation.ko: 티보가 어떤 대학에 갈지 전국 방송에서 발표합니다

translation.en: [Siler] All I knew was he's the best player in the country.
And we knew he had a lot of heart. We knew he had grit.
We knew if he was one-on-one with a tackler, he was gonna win.
translation.ko: 1 대 1 몸싸움 상황에서 무조건 이길 선수였고요

translation.en: [reporter] Did you ever picture one day, that-- that a country
translation.ko: 본인의 선택에 온 국민의 이목이 집중될 거라고 생각한 적 있나요?

translation.en: would want to see what you're gonna decide?
translation.ko: 온 국민의 이목이 집중될 거라고 생각한 적 있나요?

translation.en: Uh, no, sir. And, you know, we'll just see.
translation.ko: 아니요 두고 봐야죠, 기대됩니다 그 문제에 집중하고 있어요

translation.en: It's just exciting so I'm trying to concentrate on this.
translation.ko: 두고 봐야죠, 기대됩니다 그 문제에 집중하고 있어요

translation.en: [Meyer] I put the full-court press on him for months.
translation.ko: 몇 달 동안 티보한테 압박 공세를 펼쳤습니다

translation.en: And I was on the phone with him, writing personal letters, non-stop.
This is from Coach Meyer. "TT." He calls you TT.
-Yeah. -Has he been calling you that?
Only in some letters.
[Tebow] Honestly, I was really, really torn.
And my dad says, "Timmy, why don't you go do this?"
"Go to your room, get on your knees, pray about it."
"In the morning, I believe God will put on your heart where you're supposed to go."
translation.ko: '그럼 아침에 주님께서 네 마음에 답을 주실 거야'

translation.en: So I wake up the next morning. And I have no idea where I'm supposed to go. [laughs]
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침이 돼도 결심이 안 서더라고요

translation.en: [Finebaum] The rumor was he wanted to go to Alabama.
translation.ko: "플로리다와 앨라배마 티보의 선택은?" 티보가 앨라배마를 생각한다는 소문이 돌았는데

translation.en: But I'm not sure I understood what Urban Meyer understood,
that if he missed on Tebow, he was not going to succeed.
It was really that simple.
[Meyer] He was praying at the lake all day with his dog.
translation.ko: 티보는 개랑 호수에 가서 종일 기도를 했어요

translation.en: That was how he was going to make his decision.
And then finally, at about five till five,
I'm caught in traffic a little bit, my cell phone rings, I see it's Tim Tebow.
translation.ko: 그날 4시 45분쯤 길이 막혀 차에 있는데 팀 티보가 전화를 했어요

translation.en: Coach Meyer in a--
Panicking, 'cause he knows in ten minutes I gotta tell the world on TV,
translation.ko: 마이어 감독님은 엄청 초조한 상태였죠 10분 후면 TV에서 발표할 시간인데

translation.en: and he can't believe I hadn't called him to let him know yet.
translation.ko: 그때까지도 제 선택을 말씀 안 드렸으니까요

translation.en: He goes, "Coach, I just want you to know that--"
And he's, like, sobbing on the phone.
"…I've decided to--" And then the phone goes dead.
And I started punching the dashboard. And I--
I really thought we lost him.
The time has come. Tim Tebow, one of the top-ranked quarterbacks
translation.ko: 미국 고교 풋볼 최상위권 쿼터백 팀 티보가

translation.en: in all the United States in high school, and now it's time to go to college.
translation.ko: 미국 고교 풋볼 최상위권 쿼터백 팀 티보가 대학 진학을 앞두고 있습니다

translation.en: Where will you be playing college football?
I will be playing college football next year at the University of Florida.
translation.ko: 저는 내년에 플로리다 대학교에서 뛰기로 했습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Tim Tebow, considered one of the nation's top high school quarterbacks,
translation.ko: 미국 고교 풋볼 최상위권 쿼터백 팀 티보가

translation.en: has committed to Florida.
First and foremost, I would like to thank the lord Jesus Christ
translation.ko: 가장 먼저 주 예수 그리스도께 감사를 올립니다

translation.en: for giving me the opportunity to play this awesome game.
His ability to both run and throw seems to make him an ideal fit
translation.ko: 티보는 공을 잘 던지고 잘 뛰어서

translation.en: for Urban Meyer's spread offense with the Gators.
translation.ko: 마이어 감독의 스프레드 오펜스에 제격일 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: [Meyer] You know, I really believed that we were gonna win. And he was gonna lead us to the promised land.
translation.ko: 이제 이길 수 있다고 생각했죠 티보가 승리를 안겨줄 거라고요

translation.en: [Finebaum] It wasn't just a minor event that occurred that December day.
translation.ko: "톱 쿼터백, 게이터스행" 그건 그냥 12월 어느 날의 소소한 사건이 아니었어요

translation.en: It changed the history of college football in the South.
translation.ko: 남부 대학 풋볼의 역사를 바꿔놓은 사건이죠

translation.en: [Dooley] Everyone wanted to play with Tebow.
He was that kind of a Pied Piper kind of a quarterback.
It wasn't just a leader. It was a guy, you want to be around him.
translation.ko: 리더십만 좋은 게 아니라 친해지고 싶은 사람이에요

translation.en: Brandon, where you gonna go?
Well, next year, I will be attending University of Florida.
All right, Urban Meyer gets one of the best defensive players in the country.
translation.ko: 어번 마이어가 전국 최고의 수비수를 얻었네요

translation.en: [Spikes] One of the reasons I committed to Florida, the best players was going.
translation.ko: 제가 플로리다를 선택한 건 최고의 선수들이 있어서였죠

translation.en: I feel like we had the number one class and we did had so much talent.
We was loaded!
Let it go, man! Let your body go! Let your body go!
[Finebaum] You had Brandon Spikes, Brandon James, you had Percy Harvin.
translation.ko: 브랜던 스파이크스, 브랜던 제임스 퍼시 하빈도 있었어요

translation.en: My major decision was, uh, based on Tebow, my teammate,
translation.ko: 동료 선수 티보 때문에 이 팀에 오기로 했습니다

translation.en: and, uh, I just tried to let 'em know, in a few years, we gonna win the National Championship.
translation.ko: 몇 년 안에 내셔널 챔피언십에서 우승할 거란 걸 보여주고 싶어요

translation.en: [Finebaum] These weren't just good players. I mean, these were elite.
translation.ko: 그냥 잘하는 정도가 아니라 엘리트 선수들이었어요

translation.en: I still remember the moment of coming on campus,
arriving on campus for the first time, without my mom or my big brother,
translation.ko: 어머니나 형 없이 저 혼자 도착해서

translation.en: or somebody to, like, you know? I'm like, "I'm really out here by myself."
translation.ko: 어머니나 형 없이 저 혼자 도착해서 '이제 진짜 나 혼자구나' 했죠

translation.en: You got the beautiful women on campus, studying in no clothes, the palm trees.
translation.ko: 공부하던 예쁜 여학생들 시원한 옷차림, 야자나무

translation.en: I kind of took it all in, and I knew it was a blessing to be there.
translation.ko: 그 광경을 보고 있자니 여기 온 게 축복이다 싶었죠

translation.en: [Dooley] Florida's with the big boys now.
Before, they would have really nice recruiting classes,
translation.ko: 먼저 들어온 선수들도 정말 잘하긴 했어요

translation.en: might finish seventh or eighth in the country.
But now they had the chance to be the best class in the country.
translation.ko: 그런데 새로 들어온 선수들로 최고가 될 가능성이 열린 거죠

translation.en: I told you when camp started, I've never felt like I've felt this year.
translation.ko: 내가 올해 같은 마음으로 훈련 캠프를 시작한 적이 없다

translation.en: Energized, refreshed, because we got people who give a shit about one another.
translation.ko: 너희가 서로를 생각해 주니 힘이 나고 새로워진 기분이야

translation.en: 'Cause you got people who give a shit about the game of football.
You got people who give a shit about the University of Florida.
That's a hell of a deal, ain't it? Come on. That's a hell of a deal.
translation.ko: 그게 엄청난 동력이지 말해봐, 그렇지 않아?

translation.en: I wasn't a five-star or four-star recruit, Parade All-American. None of that stuff.
translation.ko: 저는 스카우트 대상 중에 상위 클래스는 아니었어요 "브랜던 제임스 '06~'09년 리터너/와이드 리시버"

translation.en: I was small, tiny. Super tiny.
The minute Coach Meyer walks in the door, he sits down, we started talking,
translation.ko: 마이어 감독님이 오셔서 같이 얘기를 했어요

translation.en: he gave, "Look, from day one, you're gonna have a chance to play."
And no other school had told me that. Especially my size.
translation.ko: 그런 말은 처음 들었어요 저는 몸집도 작으니까요

translation.en: -[whistle blows] -[man] Down!
[Meyer] You'd have to be blind not to see great talent.
But I wanted to be as hard as I could on these players.
You're not performing, you get called out. That's the way it is.
translation.ko: 제대로 안 하면 뺀다 그게 내 법칙이야

translation.en: [Meyer] You know, we're gonna put you in the most difficult situations.
And some people thrive, some people pack their bags.
We're all family, we're gonna be one machine
translation.ko: 우린 한 가족이다 2주 반 후에는 하나의 기계가 되는 거야

translation.en: in about two-and-a-half weeks, that's it.
translation.ko: 2주 반 후에는 하나의 기계가 되는 거야

translation.en: [Baker] We would work out from midnight until, like, 2:30 on a Friday or a Saturday night,
when you want to go to the club, or you want to go to a bar,
translation.ko: 다들 클럽이나 술집 파티에 가고 싶어도

translation.en: you want to go to a house party. No.
translation.ko: 다들 클럽이나 술집 파티에 가고 싶어도 안 갔어요

translation.en: We would work out at midnight.
[man] Let's go!
Training every day is to the max.
Like, it was literally to the max. And I didn't want no part of that.
It was awesome.
Those are some of my favorite nights of my life.
[Tebow] No matter how much you'd prepare, you know in that workout
translation.ko: 아무리 준비를 많이 해도 그렇게 운동하다 보면

translation.en: that everything in you is going to say, "Stop."
But will you?
Workouts was hard,
'cause it was ones-on-ones sometimes, Urban didn't care.
translation.ko: 근력 운동은 힘들었어요 나와의 싸움이었으니까요 감독님은 신경 안 쓰시고 매일 발전하라고만 하셨죠

translation.en: He just wanted to see us get better. His thing was, "Get better every day."
translation.ko: 감독님은 신경 안 쓰시고 매일 발전하라고만 하셨죠

translation.en: [Tebow] Everything was win or lose.
Everything is praise or embarrassment.
Everything.
Everything.
[Tebow] Every now and then, maybe it…
went a little too far into sometimes embarrassing guys in front of the team.
translation.ko: 선을 넘어서 동료들 앞에서 망신을 주기도 했어요

translation.en: And for some guys, it pushed them to never want to experience that again,
translation.ko: 어떤 선수들은 다시는 망신 안 당하려고

translation.en: and it made them great.
And for others,
I think it hurt 'em too much.
[Siler] Urban introduced the champions club.
He put tape on the ground, and wherever we ate.
And if you were in the champions' club, you had white linens on your table,
translation.ko: 챔피언 클럽이 되면 흰 식탁보가 깔린 테이블에서

translation.en: you ate steak, you ate lobster,
you had a server that brought you food.
If you were on the other side of that tape,
you ate hot dogs and hamburgers. You had to go get it yourself.
translation.ko: 테이프 반대쪽에서는 핫도그랑 햄버거를 먹고 음식도 직접 가져와야 했죠

translation.en: Urban said, "I'm gonna treat my superstars like superstars,
and I'mma treat my shit like shit."
"If I treat you like shit, and you want me to change,
then you find a way to make yourself into a superstar,
and I'll start treating you like that."
To me, I was like, "Oh!"
"That is so profound."
Every coach does it, but no coach says it.
translation.ko: 코치들은 다 그렇게 하지만 그걸 말로 하지는 않거든요

translation.en: You go out, and when it's time for you to make the tackle,
translation.ko: 경기에 나가면 태클이 필요할 때 제대로 해야 해요

translation.en: make the fucking tackle.
translation.ko: 태클이 필요할 때 제대로 해야 해요

translation.en: [Meyer] When we recruit players, I tell 'em, "This is the hardest program in America."
translation.ko: 선수들을 영입할 때 우린 미국에서 제일 힘들게 훈련시킨다고 합니다

translation.en: There's no second-place trophies at Florida Gator football.
translation.ko: 플로리다 게이터스 풋볼팀은 2등 같은 거 안 쳐줘요

translation.en: [announcer] What a great day to lock in, and a lot at stake.
translation.ko: 경기장 오기 좋은 날입니다 오늘 굉장히 중요한 경기죠

translation.en: Tonight, either Florida or Tennessee, these two bitter rivals,
translation.ko: 오늘 밤, 플로리다와 테네시 이 최대 라이벌 중에 이기는 팀이

translation.en: will win a victory, seize control early of the SEC East.
translation.ko: 이 최대 라이벌 중에 이기는 팀이 동부 SEC를 조기에 장악할 겁니다

translation.en: Tennessee is a fucking joke! We're set up for us to take this shit!
translation.ko: 테네시는 쥐뿔도 아니야 우리 목표는 승리다!

translation.en: [Meyer] The SEC eats you up and spits you right out.
The year before, we lost three SEC games.
You know what happens again if you lose three SEC games?
translation.ko: SEC에서 세 번 지면 어떻게 되는지 아세요?

translation.en: There's probably be a new coach there.
[Tebow] Okay, you know, I don't know how this is gonna go,
but I know there's only one thing that I can control,
translation.ko: 제가 통제할 수 있는 건 있죠

translation.en: and that's gonna be my attitude, my effort, and my focus.
You the best in the country! Do you understand? Get this shit going right now!
translation.ko: 넌 미국 최고의 선수야 한번 해보자고!

translation.en: [Baker] Football was all I knew. I grew up in the hood,
translation.ko: 저는 풋볼밖에 몰랐어요 거친 동네에서 자라면서 사람이 살해되는 것도 봤죠

translation.en: seeing people being killed.
translation.ko: 거친 동네에서 자라면서 사람이 살해되는 것도 봤죠

translation.en: If I don't play football, like, I'm a nobody.
Make the fucking big play, Dallas, right now!
Make the big play!
All right? Get the ball, we're--
[player] Our father… [all] …who art in Heaven, hallowed be thy name,
translation.ko: 하늘에 계신 우리 아버지 이름이 거룩히 여김을 받으시고

translation.en: thy kingdom come, thy will be done,
translation.ko: 나라가 임하시오며 뜻이 하늘에서와 같이 땅에서도 이루어지이다

translation.en: on Earth as it is in Heaven,
give us this day our daily bread, forgive…
I couldn't really feel my hands, they were shaking.
[Baker] This game is gonna tell us how good we really are.
translation.ko: 그 경기로 우리 실력이 판가름 날 테니까요

translation.en: It's all about now. It's all about now.
You work your whole life for a couple moments,
you got that moment right now. Squeeze tight.
[Meyer] That pressure was immense. We need this game.
If we fail to win this game, we're in trouble.
Let the toughest motherfucker win this game.
Right now! Right, Joe?
Let the toughest motherfucker win this game!
-[man] Y'all boys ready? Y'all boys ready? -[all] Hell yeah!
-Y'all boys ready? -Shit! -Y'all boys ready? -Shit! -Y'all boys ready? -Hell yeah!
For Urban Meyer, it was time. It was time to put up or shut up.
translation.ko: 어번 마이어한테 중요한 순간이었어요 말이 아니라 결과로 보여줄 때였죠

translation.en: [announcer] Urban Meyer has talked all summer long
translation.ko: 어번 마이어는 여름 내내 강해져야 한다고 말했습니다

translation.en: about being tough, being composed,
translation.ko: 어번 마이어는 여름 내내 강해져야 한다고 말했습니다 침착하게 승리를 향해 나아가야 한다고요

translation.en: going on the road and winning.
First down and ten.
This is Percy Harvin, the freshman.
He has electrified the crowd.
[Meyer] We started strong.
[announcer] Leak has it, pulls back, fires left side. Oh!
translation.ko: 리크가 공을 잡고 빠져서 왼쪽 측면으로 던져줍니다

translation.en: Touchdown!
[Meyer] The crowd was booing us, and screaming.
And I'm watching this little, arrogant nut job, Brandon James,
translation.ko: 그런데 브랜던 제임스 그 시건방진 미친놈이

translation.en: start looking at the crowd and, like, taunting the crowd.
His arrogance, his confidence was over the moon.
translation.ko: 자신감이 도를 넘어서 건방지기 짝이 없었죠

translation.en: [James] I came into the game with the mindset to prove something.
I wanted to prove that even though I was small, I was able to play.
translation.ko: 덩치는 작아도 잘한다는 걸 보여주고 싶었죠

translation.en: [Spikes] Freshman, 18 years old, he hadn't even played in a big game yet.
translation.ko: 제임스는 18살 1학년이라 큰 경기에 나간 적이 없었어요

translation.en: He would sit and tell me, "They kick me the ball, I'm telling you, I'm taking it to the house."
translation.ko: 자기한테 공을 주면 터치다운을 할 거라길래

translation.en: I'm like, "You ain't finna do nothing, man."
It's like, "Let 'em kick me the ball. You'll see."
Like, "I'mma score, I'm telling you. I'mma score. I might score twice."
[James] Coach Meyer, he go, "Hey, you're out there." "What?"
[laughs] "Like, now?" He's like, "Yeah."
I didn't give him a chance to say yea or nay, I just ran on the field.
translation.ko: 마음 바뀌시기 전에 냅다 필드로 뛰어나갔죠

translation.en: [announcer] Brandon James awaits this one.
[James] The first time I touched the ball, I caught it.
translation.ko: 공이 손에 처음 닿았을 때 잡아서 수비를 뚫으며 뛰었어요

translation.en: Kinda split the defense, running straight up through the defense.
As I started getting closer to that checkerboard, I was like, "Oh!"
My eyes started getting big. "Man, you're about to score a touchdown."
I made a move on the punter… and he actually tripped me.
translation.ko: 펀터 쪽으로 달려갔는데 저한테 다리를 걸더라고요

translation.en: [announcer] I'll tell you, that guy is a weapon.
I was watching from the sideline. I was like, "Wow." "That's amazing, man."
"They told you you was too small, and look at you."
translation.ko: 왜소하다는 말만 듣더니 일을 낸 거예요

translation.en: [announcer] That's a first down, Tennessee, here. Florida leading 7-3.
translation.ko: 테네시의 퍼스트 다운 플로리다가 7 대 3으로 앞선 상황

translation.en: Here's the reverse. And they set up the pass.
Tennessee, they have great players all over the field,
and they start kicking us around a little bit.
[announcer] Oh, they've got a man wide open!
Lucas Taylor… in the corner.
Touchdown!
This one winds up, at the break, with a Tennessee Volunteer lead.
translation.ko: 하프 타임을 앞두고 테네시 발런티어스가 득점하며 앞서갑니다

translation.en: Too bad we're not in the fucking Swamp. This would be about 32 to zip right now. Thirty-two to zip!
translation.ko: 우리 홈이 아닌 게 한이다 그랬으면 32 대 0은 됐겠지

translation.en: What happens, as a coach, you start to think,
"What if we lose? How do I keep this team together?"
Togetherness and toughness. You remember I said that.
Togetherness and toughness, you fucking win this game.
translation.ko: 단결력과 강인함, 내 말 기억하지? 그게 있으면 이긴다 이기자, 댈러스, 빨리 나와!

translation.en: You win this game, Dallas. Let's go, right now! Let's go!
translation.ko: 그게 있으면 이긴다 이기자, 댈러스, 빨리 나와!

translation.en: -[all] Let's go! -[player] Get it to ten, baby, come on.
-Showtime on three! One, two, three… -[all] Showtime!
translation.ko: - 하나, 둘, 셋, 쇼 타임! - 쇼 타임!

translation.en: [Baker] So we come out from halftime…
[announcer] Second down.
…they score just that quick.
[announcer] Hardesty gets it. Touchdown, Tennessee.
[Baker] I knew I need to lead by example.
[announcer] Leak under pressure, touchdown!
Catch is made by Dallas Baker.
Let's go! Hey! Let's go!
Hey! Make a play! Make a play.
[player] Let's go! Let's go, baby.
[Mullen] The Tennessee game was a battle.
[announcer] Blitz. Leak…
[Mullen] And if one play could encapture that game,
translation.ko: 플레이 한 번으로 승부를 내야 하는데

translation.en: it came in a third down and ten,
late in the game, and we're losing.
[announcer] Leak, quarterback draw, slides, and he came up short.
And Chris Leak scrambles and falls just short of the first down.
translation.ko: 크리스 리크가 퍼스트 다운을 코앞에 두고 넘어졌어요

translation.en: And here it is, a fourth down and one.
If we don't get this first down, we lose the game.
translation.ko: 이번에 퍼스트 다운을 획득 못 하면 지는 거였는데

translation.en: And I know that's not going to be Chris's strong point.
[announcer] Tennessee leads by six, 20-14.
Tim Tebow, the highly-touted freshman quarterback, is in.
translation.ko: 큰 화제였던 1학년 쿼터백 팀 티보가 들어옵니다

translation.en: And so we tried out young freshman Tim Tebow
to just run somebody over, to get the first down.
translation.ko: 퍼스트 다운을 획득하려면 돌파하는 힘이 필요했거든요

translation.en: It was so loud, and 110,000 people, national TV,
translation.ko: 함성이 어마어마했어요 관중 11만 명과 전국 시청자들이 보고 있었죠

translation.en: and I grab him, and I said, "Okay, it's time."
[Tebow] When the game's on the line against a huge rival,
translation.ko: 엄청난 라이벌과 싸우는 중요한 경기인 데다

translation.en: in my first-ever SEC game,
translation.ko: 저는 SEC 경기에 처음 나간 건데

translation.en: my teammates and my coaches, they were willing to put it in my hands in that moment.
translation.ko: 동료들과 코치님들이 저를 믿고 맡겨준 거예요

translation.en: That meant the world to me.
[announcer] Snap is perfect. Tebow uses that 6'3" frame
translation.ko: 완벽한 스냅 티보가 191cm의 체격으로 퍼스트 다운을 향해 헤쳐 나갑니다

translation.en: to struggle for the first down.
translation.ko: 티보가 191cm의 체격으로 퍼스트 다운을 향해 헤쳐 나갑니다

translation.en: I'm like, "Wow, pretty friggin' fun."
Tim Tebow jumps up, and-- It was first down.
translation.ko: 팀 티보가 기세 좋게 퍼스트 다운을 해냈죠

translation.en: [announcer] Chris Leak stoically says, "Nicely done."
translation.ko: 크리스 리크가 침착한 얼굴로 잘했다고 하네요

translation.en: [Mullen] I think in that moment, he ran off the field, and Chris ran on.
translation.ko: 그때 티보가 달려 나왔고 크리스도 달려갔어요

translation.en: [announcer] Second and four.
[commentator] Now, anything close, you're going to continue to go for it,
with under seven minutes to go in the game.
[announcer] Pulls up, Leak… Got a man wide open!
translation.ko: 공 준비, 리크 공간이 활짝 열려 있습니다

translation.en: [Mullen] And two plays later…
Chris threw the game-winning touchdown pass to Dallas Baker.
translation.ko: 크리스의 결정적인 패스를 댈러스가 터치다운으로 연결했죠

translation.en: [sportscaster] Pass complete to Baker for a Florida touchdown.
It was phenomenal.
[announcer] Talk about a signature win.
A huge win.
Maybe this is that moment in time when Florida gets serious again.
translation.ko: 플로리다가 다시 일어선 게 바로 그때일 겁니다

translation.en: After that game, we knew we were gonna be good.
How sweet, baby! How sweet, baby!
[Siler] "National Championship? It's possible."
translation.ko: 내셔널 챔피언십 우승도 가능할 것 같았어요

translation.en: Something that has been done only one time
in the history of the hundred years of Florida football.
translation.ko: 플로리다 풋볼의 100년 역사에서 단 한 번 이뤄졌던 일이요

translation.en: ♪ Cheer for the team at play ♪
♪ On to the goal We’ll fight our way… ♪
[Siler] Let's go chase it. Let's go get it.
And I didn't think that anybody could beat us.
translation.ko: 그 누구도 우리를 못 이길 거라 생각했어요

translation.en: [announcer] Florida Gators have gone down at Auburn.
To win a National Championship, it's not that easy.
translation.ko: 내셔널 챔피언십 우승은 쉬운 게 아닙니다

translation.en: [announcer] Tim Tebow, the freshman.
[Tebow] This team has the chance to be so special,
translation.ko: 아주 특별한 팀이 될 기회가 왔고

translation.en: and we were so close to doing it.
[announcer] 90,000-plus holding their breath.
